moves.1. c4:
This is from a rather short game, I would be interested in any comments.

As white I have been doing some experimenting with the English opening with varying degrees of success
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Bc5 3. Nf3 Nc6: This is the first time I have been able to attempt the pawn fork ploy and as you will see it all went to plan
moves.4. Nxe5 Nxe5 5. d4 Bxd4 6. Qxd4 Nc6 7. Q: I wanted to see what black would do here, I was expecting Qe7
moves.7... Nge7: I have my doubts about this move as black as it seems to block him in, although he can castle, what then?
moves.8. Bg5: I liked this move as it develops with tempo and if black castles I still have his knight pinned and am threatening Nd5 to pressure the e7 knight more
moves.8... O-O 9. e3: Allows me to develop my lsb
moves.9... Re8: I was expecting d6 here which would allow black to develop his lsb or even f6
moves.10. Bd3: Black looks rather cramped to me he seems to be looking for a queen exchange but this move threatens Qxh7 which looks nasty for black
moves.10... g6: I'm not clear what other options black had here - if any
moves.11. Qh4: I was trying to work out how to break open the pawns around the black king, this looked like a reasonable start, combined with aiming to get my knight to f6
moves.11... h5: I'm not sure that this was necessary, maybe black panicked as now I have the option of g4
moves.12. Nd5: Heading for f6 and coincidentally threatening the black knight
moves.12... Nf5: I was still expecting something like d6
moves.13. Bxf5:
Black resigned. 

Thanks for reading please comment
